metadata.title: CVE-2016-3715 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The EPHEMERAL coder in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.x before 7.0.1-1allows remote attackers to delete arbitrary files via a crafted image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.1').
graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1').
